Patch Your MatLab for MAC Yosemite

14 Feb 2015

Are you feeling excited about the brand new OS X Yosemite? Yeah, me too. But I delayed my update until recently due to the notorious "Matlab does not open in MAC OS bug".

While the bug is fixed for R2014b, following the instruction here can save your past installation of 2011a — swiftly in 10 minutes.

What you need is a patch R20xxx_patch_1098655.dmg for your corresponding matlab version. Following the instruction, you will be able to open the MATLAB.

If you are using a MAC pro with retina display as I do, you might feel the text on MATLAB is blurry.

While there are many solutions you can find. The following one seems to be a quick one.

  1. Install the latest JRE from www.java.com
  2. Open up your terminal and type the following command: 
    $cd /Applications/MATLAB_R2014a.app/sys/java/jre/maci64
$mv jre/ jre.orig
$ln -s /Library/Internet\ Plug-Ins/JavaAppletPlugin.plugin/Contents/Home/ jre

Re-start your Matlab app and you are all set.
